lines.gurmukhi: cIkny kls pr jYsy nw itkq bUMd kwlr mYN pry nwj inpjY n Kyq jI
lines.transliteration_english: Cheekanay Kalas Par Jaisay Naa Tikat Boonda , Kaalar Main Paray Naaj Nipajai N Khayt Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a drop of water does not rest on a greasy pitcher and no seed grows in a saline soil.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Dir pr qru sybl APl Aru ibiKAw ibrK Ply jgu duK dyq jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dhari Par Taru Saybal Adhal Aru , Bikhiaa Birakh Dhalay Jagu Doukh Dayt Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as silk cotton tree is bereft of fruit on this earth, and just as a poisonous tree causes much trouble to the people.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn subws bwNs bws bws bwsIAY nw pvn gvn ml mUqqw smyq jI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Soubaas Baans Baas Baas Baaseeai Naa , Pavan Gavan Mal Mootataa Samayt Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bamboo tree acquires no fragrance despite living near a sandalwood tree, and just as the air blowing over filth acquires the same bad odour.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys prvys n mo irdY iBdy jYsy mwno s√çwNiqbUMd Aih muK lyq jI ]638]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Paravays N Mo Ridai Bhiday , Jaisay Maano Svaantiboond Ahi Moukh Layt Jee ?638?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly being like a greasy pitcher, saline land, silk cotton tree, bamboo tree and filth-polluted air, the sermon of the True Guru does not pierce my heart (it creates no ambrosial elixir). On the contrary, it feels as if a snake has just taken swati.
